News.Title: GPT Infraprojects Projects 25%+ Revenue Growth
News.Summary: GPT Infraprojects estimates over 25% revenue growth for FY27, driven by strong order book and improved margins from African operations.

News.Title: GPT Infraprojects Q3FY26 Results & Strategic Moves
News.Summary: GPT Infraprojects reports Q3FY26 results with ₹27,327.35 crore revenue, declares 7.5% interim dividend, and announces major acquisition of Alcon Builders for ₹154.19 crore to enter railway signaling segment.

News.Title: GPT Infraprojects Board Meet Set for Jan 28, 2026
News.Summary: GPT Infraprojects schedules board meeting on January 28, 2026 to consider Q3FY26 unaudited financial results and potential second interim dividend for FY2025-26.

News.Title: GPT Infraprojects Wins ₹669.2 Cr NHAI Contract
News.Summary: GPT Infraprojects secures major infrastructure contract from NHAI worth ₹669.2 crores for constructing four-lane elevated road in Jodhpur. Company's share stands at ₹341.3 crores with order book reaching ₹4,655 crores.

News.Title: GPT Infraprojects Appoints MUFG Intime for IR Services
News.Summary: GPT Infraprojects Limited has appointed MUFG Intime India Pvt. Ltd. as its Investor Relations Agency effective January 1, 2026, to strengthen investor communication and enhance capital market visibility.

News.Title: GPT Infraprojects Wins ₹199.2 Cr Railway Bridge Contract
News.Summary: GPT Infraprojects Limited secured a ₹199.2 crore contract for constructing railway bridges over river Rapti for North Eastern Railway, to be completed in 730 days.

News.Title: GPT Infraprojects Wins ₹199 Crore Contract
News.Summary: GPT Infraprojects has secured a significant infrastructure contract valued at ₹199 crores, marking a major business development for the company in its operational expansion.

News.Title: GPT Infraprojects Wins ₹670 Cr Highway Project
News.Summary: GPT Infraprojects Limited declared L1 bidder for ₹670 crore NHAI highway construction project in Jodhpur, Rajasthan in consortium with ISCPPL on December 22, 2025.

News.Title: GPT Infraprojects Leads Consortium for ₹6.70 Bn Project
News.Summary: GPT Infraprojects emerges as lowest bidder leading consortium for significant infrastructure project worth ₹6.70 billion, marking major business development for the company.

News.Title: GPT Infraprojects JV Wins ₹18.04 Billion Contract
News.Summary: GPT Infraprojects' joint venture secured a major contract worth ₹18.04 billion, with the company holding a 26% stake valued at ₹4.70 billion in this significant infrastructure project.

News.Title: GPT Infraprojects Wins ₹1,739.49 Cr Mumbai Flyover Order
News.Summary: GPT Infraprojects Limited declared L1 bidder for ₹1,739.49 crore MCGM flyover project through joint venture with 26% share worth ₹452.27 crores for LBS Marg construction work.

News.Title: GPT Infraprojects Wins ₹53.6 Cr Railway Contract
News.Summary: GPT Infraprojects secured a ₹53.60 crore contract from South Eastern Railway to supply 142,400 concrete sleepers within 24 months, strengthening its railway infrastructure portfolio.

News.Title: GPT Infraprojects Secures ₹199 Crore Order
News.Summary: GPT Infraprojects has won a significant infrastructure order valued at ₹199 crores, marking a notable business development for the company in its operational portfolio.

News.Title: Gpt Infraprojects Secures 1.99 Billion Rupee Order
News.Summary: Gpt Infraprojects has won a new order valued at 1.99 billion rupees. This order win represents a significant business development for the infrastructure company.

News.Title: GPT Sons Private Limited Increases Stake in GPT Infraprojects Limited to 48%
News.Summary: GPT Sons Private Limited acquired 1,86,758 equity shares (0.148%) of GPT Infraprojects Limited through open market transactions between November 24-28, 2025, increasing its shareholding from 47.85% to 48.00%. The acquisition strengthens the promoter group's control in the infrastructure company, with the total equity capital remaining at Rs. 1,26,36,46,000 divided into 12,63,64,600 shares of Rs. 10 each.

News.Title: GPT Infra Targets ₹2,000 Crore New Orders This Year With 20% Revenue Growth Plan
News.Summary: GPT Infra aims to secure ₹2,000 crore in new orders this year and expects to complete its current order book of ₹3,591 crore over the next 2.5 years. The company targets 20% revenue growth for FY'26 and plans to maintain this growth rate for the following three years. GPT Infra also expects to sustain long-term EBITDA margins of 13-14%.

News.Title: GPT Infraprojects Reports Strong Growth with Net Profit Rising to ₹4,366.50 Lakhs in H1 FY26
News.Summary: GPT Infraprojects Limited announced its quarterly results for the quarter and half year ended September 30, 2025. The company reported total revenue of ₹58,978.36 lakhs for the quarter and ₹1,17,429.61 lakhs for the half year. Net profit after tax reached ₹4,366.50 lakhs for the quarter and ₹8,852.16 lakhs for the half year. On a consolidated basis, the company achieved revenue of ₹59,330.56 lakhs for the half year with net profit of ₹7,768.00 lakhs. The company operates through two main segments: Infrastructure and Concrete Sleeper. Earnings per share stood at 3.46 for the half year. The auditors highlighted an ongoing arbitration proceeding involving one of the company's joint operations with uncertainty over recovery of ₹662.58 lakhs in unbilled revenue and trade receivables from a customer.

News.Title: GPT Infraprojects Co-Chair Projects Over 20% Growth This Year
News.Summary: GPT Infraprojects' Co-Chair has expressed expectations for the company to achieve growth exceeding 20% this year.

News.Title: GPT Infraprojects Reports 24% Growth in Q2 Net Profit Despite Revenue Decline
News.Summary: GPT Infraprojects reported consolidated net profit of 218 million rupees for Q2, representing a 24% increase from 176 million rupees in the same quarter last year. However, the company's revenue declined to 2.79 billion rupees compared to 2.9 billion rupees in the previous year's corresponding quarter, marking a 3.8% decrease year-over-year.

News.Title: GPT Infra Secures ₹37.8 Crore Railway Contract from Eastern Railway
News.Summary: GPT Infraprojects Limited announced winning a ₹37.8 crore contract from Eastern Railway for civil and associated work for capacity augmentation facilities for Wagon POH in Jamalpur workshop. The order is part of a joint venture with GPT's share being 51%, and the project is to be executed within 18 months. The company operates through Infrastructure and Sleeper segments, focusing on railway infrastructure projects including bridges and ROBs, and manufactures concrete sleepers for railways in India and Africa. GPT Infra has manufacturing units in West Bengal, South Africa, Namibia, and Ghana, with an outstanding order book of ₹4,066.9 crore and total order inflow for Fiscal 2026 of ₹610 crore.

News.Title: GPT Infraprojects Wins ₹195 Crore International Contract for Conveyor Belt System in Ivory Coast
News.Summary: GPT Infraprojects Limited secured a ₹195 crore contract from Terminal Industriel Polyvalent de San Pedro in Ivory Coast for supply, installation, testing and commissioning of conveyor belt system. The international project involves detailed engineering and installation work for Phase 2 development connecting SOCIM and TIPSP to the port terminal, with execution timeline of 12 months. The contract value is approximately Euro 18.9 million. The company's outstanding order book stands at ₹4,047.65 crore with total order inflow of ₹591 crore for Fiscal 2026. GPT Infraprojects operates in infrastructure and sleeper segments, with manufacturing units in India and Africa including South Africa, Namibia and Ghana.

News.Title: GPT Infraprojects Appoints Dr. Om Tantia as Chairman, Elevates Atul Tantia to Joint MD Following Board Changes
News.Summary: GPT Infraprojects' Board of Directors appointed Dr. Om Tantia as Additional Non-Executive Director and Chairman following the demise of Shri Dwarika Prasad Tantia. The company elevated Mr. Atul Tantia from Executive Director & CFO to Joint Managing Director & CFO, subject to shareholder approval. The board also approved adoption of new Memorandum and Articles of Association aligned with Companies Act 2013, and reconstituted the Corporate Social Responsibility Committee with Dr. Om Tantia as Chairman. A postal ballot notice was approved to seek shareholder approval for these changes. Dr. Om Tantia brings 41 years of medical practice experience and is a founding member of ILS Hospital, while Mr. Atul Tantia holds degrees from Wharton School and has over 20 years of experience in manufacturing, infrastructure, and finance.

News.Title: GPT Infraprojects Chairman and Promoter Dwarika Prasad Tantia Passes Away
News.Summary: GPT Infraprojects Limited announced the death of Shri Dwarika Prasad Tantia, Non-Executive Chairman and Promoter, on August 17, 2025. Tantia held 26,00,000 shares in the company and was described as instrumental in shaping the company's foundation and progress through his leadership and vision. He also served as Honorary Consul of the Republic of Ghana in Kolkata. The company stated that operations and prospects remain unchanged and committed to upholding his legacy while advancing the mission and values he established.

News.Title: GPT Infraprojects Reports 32% Revenue Growth in Q1 FY26, Order Book Stands at ₹3,569 Crores
News.Summary: GPT Infraprojects Limited reported strong quarterly results with revenue reaching ₹312.6 crores, representing 32% year-on-year growth. Profit after tax increased 40% to ₹23.5 crores, while consolidated EBITDA grew 37% to ₹46 crores. The company maintains a healthy order book of ₹3,569 crores with new order inflows of ₹400 crores during the year. Key contracts include a ₹351 crores bridge construction project from Agra Gwalior Highway Private Limited and a ₹13 crores concrete sleeper supply contract for Bangladesh. The Infrastructure segment contributed 95% of revenues at ₹300 crores, while the Sleeper segment generated ₹10 crores. The company declared an interim dividend of ₹1 per share and expects to maintain its long-term EBITDA target of 13%. Management projects revenue growth of 20-22% over the next 3-4 years and expects to achieve close to ₹2,000 crores revenue by FY27-28. The Ghana facility for concrete sleepers is expected to begin production this quarter with positive EBITDA contribution from Q3. Current debt position stands at ₹140 crores.

News.Title: GPT Infraprojects Forecasts 20-22% Revenue Growth Over Next 3-4 Years
News.Summary: GPT Infraprojects has outlined its financial projections and growth targets. The company expects to maintain debt levels between ₹140-150 crores by year-end. Revenue growth is projected at 20-22% for the next 3-4 years, with specific targets of 22-23% growth in FY26. The company aims to achieve nearly ₹2000 crore revenue by FY27-28. EBITDA margins are expected to remain at 13% going forward. For the concrete sleeper segment, GPT Infraprojects projects revenues of ₹85 crore domestically and ₹140 crore on a consolidated basis for FY26.

News.Title: GPT Infraprojects Publishes Q1 FY26 Financial Results and Interim Dividend Notice
News.Summary: GPT Infraprojects Limited has published its unaudited financial results for the first quarter ended June 30, 2025, along with a notice of record date for the first interim dividend for FY 2025-26 in English and regional language newspapers. The company's board has declared a first interim dividend at 10% (Re 1 per share of face value Rs 10) for the financial year 2025-26. The record date for determining eligible shareholders for the interim dividend has been set as August 11, 2025. The dividend will be paid to shareholders whose names appear in the company's register of members or as beneficial owners with depositories as of the record date.

News.Title: GPT Infraprojects Reports 40% Jump in Q1 Net Profit Despite Margin Decline
News.Summary: GPT Infraprojects reported quarterly results showing revenue growth to 3.13 billion rupees from 2.4 billion rupees year-over-year. Net profit increased to 235 million rupees compared to 168 million rupees in the same period last year. EBITDA rose to 370 million rupees from 321 million rupees year-over-year, though EBITDA margin declined to 11.84% from 13.29% in the previous year.

News.Title: GPT Infraprojects Approves Q1 Results, Declares 10% Interim Dividend
News.Summary: GPT Infraprojects Limited's board approved unaudited financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025, and declared a first interim dividend of 10% (₹1 per equity share) for Financial Year 2025-26. The company set August 11, 2025 as the record date for dividend eligibility. Additionally, Mr. Shankar Jyoti Deb will cease to be an Independent Director effective August 7, 2025, following completion of his second and final term of five consecutive years. The board meeting was held on August 4, 2025.

News.Title: GPT Infraprojects Wins ₹351 Crore Bridge Construction Contract
News.Summary: GPT Infraprojects Limited secured a ₹351 crore contract from Agra Gwalior Highway Private Limited for constructing a new major bridge, including a cable-stayed bridge, over the Chambal River as part of the Agra-Gwalior Greenfield Highway Project. The contract has no related party transactions or promoter group interest. GPT Infraprojects operates in infrastructure and sleeper segments, focusing on railway infrastructure projects including bridges and road construction. The company has manufacturing units in West Bengal, South Africa, Namibia, and Ghana, and maintains an outstanding order book of ₹3,852.65 crore with total order inflow of ₹396 crore for the fiscal year.

News.Title: GPT Infraprojects Secures ₹351 Crore Contract
News.Summary: GPT Infraprojects has secured a contract valued at ₹351 crore. The company has a market capitalization of ₹1,500 crore.

News.Title: GPT Infraproject Secures New Order Worth ₹13 Crores
News.Summary: GPT Infraproject has announced securing a new order valued at ₹13 crores. The news briefly mentions the company's name and the order value without providing additional details about the nature of the project or its timeline.

News.Title: GPT Infraprojects Declares Dividend
News.Summary: GPT Infraprojects has announced a dividend of 1 rupee per equity share.

News.Title: GPT Infraprojects Reports Q4 Financial Results
News.Summary: GPT Infraprojects announced its Q4 financial results. The company's EBITDA increased to 386 million rupees from 343 million rupees year-over-year. However, the EBITDA margin decreased to 10.14% from 11.62% in the same period. The consolidated net profit rose to 242 million rupees from 162 million rupees year-over-year. Revenue for Q4 grew to 3.8 billion rupees from 2.95 billion rupees in the previous year.

News.Title: GPT Infraprojects: Secures ₹32.29 Crore Railway Contract
News.Summary: GPT Infraprojects Ltd has won a ₹32.29 crore contract from Eastern Railway, Kolkata for manufacturing and supplying Mono Block Pre-Stressed Concrete Line Sleepers. This new order brings the company's total order book to ₹3,488.65 crore, marking the first order inflow for fiscal year 2026.

News.Title: GPT Infraprojects Secures New Order Worth ₹32 Crore
News.Summary: GPT Infraprojects, a company with a market capitalization of ₹1800 crore, has received a new order valued at ₹32 crore. This development indicates potential growth in the company's project pipeline and revenue stream.

News.Title: GPT Infraprojects to Consider Q4 Results on May 16
News.Summary: GPT Infraprojects has announced that it will consider its fourth quarter (Q4) financial results on May 16. This indicates that the company is preparing to release its earnings report for the last quarter of the fiscal year.

News.Title: GPT Infra Commissions Steel Girder Manufacturing Facility
News.Summary: GPT Infra has successfully commissioned a new steel girder manufacturing facility with an initial capacity of 10,000 MT per annum. The company has made provisions to increase the final capacity to 25,000 MTPA over the next two years.

News.Title: GPT Infraprojects Ltd: Shares Surge 11% on Major Railway Bridge Contract Win
News.Summary: GPT Infraprojects Ltd secured a Rs 481.11 crore contract from South Eastern Railway for constructing Bridge No. 57 over River Rupnarayan. The project includes viaducts and elevated platforms at Kolaghat Station on the Howrah-Kharagpur route. The company's shares rose up to 11.12% to Rs 133.59 before settling at Rs 125.30, up 4.23%.

News.Title: GPT Infrastructure Secures Order Worth ₹480 Crore
News.Summary: GPT Infrastructure has won a new order valued at ₹480 crore. The company, which operates in the infrastructure sector, has not provided additional details about the nature or scope of the order in the given news snippet.

News.Title: GPT Infrastructure Secures Order Worth 480 Crore Rupees
News.Summary: GPT Infrastructure has won a new order valued at 480 crore rupees (approximately $58 million USD). This represents a significant business development for the company, potentially boosting its project pipeline and future revenue prospects.

News.Title: GPT Infraprojects Reports Improved Q3 Financial Performance
News.Summary: GPT Infraprojects has announced its financial results for the third quarter. The company's EBITDA (Earnings Before Interest, Taxes, Depreciation, and Amortization) increased to 339 million rupees, up from 296 million rupees in the same quarter of the previous year. Additionally, the EBITDA margin improved to 12.18% from 11.64% year-over-year.

News.Title: GPT Infraprojects Reports Q3 Revenue Increase
News.Summary: GPT Infraprojects has announced its financial results for the third quarter. The company's revenue for Q3 stood at 2.8 billion rupees, showing an increase from 2.54 billion rupees in the same period last year.

News.Title: GPT Infraprojects Reports Increased Q3 Consolidated Net Profit
News.Summary: GPT Infraprojects has reported a consolidated net profit of 214 million rupees for the third quarter, showing an increase from 149 million rupees in the same period last year. This represents a year-over-year growth in the company's financial performance.
